mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities module¶

Utilities that can be used throughout a variety of path planners

mavsim_python

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Last updated:

    4/3/2019 - Brady Moon 4/11/2019 - RWB 3/31/2020 - RWB 4/2022 - GND

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.column(A: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], i: int) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Extracts the ith column of A and return column vector

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.distance(start_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → float¶

compute distance between start and end pose

Parameters:

  • start_pose – pose one

  • end_pose – pose two

Returns:

distance between start and end poses

Return type:

d

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.exist_feasible_path(start_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], world_map: MsgWorldMap) → bool¶

check to see of path from start_pose to end_pose colliding with map

existFeasiblePath() routine from Algorithm 12

Parameters:

  • start_pose – starting point on a line

  • end_pose – ending point on a line

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

Returns:

True => path is feasible, False => path collides with obstacle

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.find_closest_configuration(tree: MsgWaypoints, pos_in: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → tuple[ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], int, float]¶

Returns the closest waypoint in tree to the passed in 3x1 position

findClosestConfiguration() routine used in Algorithm 12

Parameters:

  • tree – Current set of waypoints in rrt search tree

  • pos_in – The position to be used for comparison

Returns:

The 3x1 position that is closest to pos_in idx: The index of pos_closest in tree.ned dist: The distance from tree.get_ned(idx)

Return type:

pos_closest

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.find_shortest_path(tree: MsgWaypoints, end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → MsgWaypoints¶

Find the lowest cost path to the end node.

findShortestPath(…) from Algorithm 12

Parameters:

  • tree – Current set of waypoints in rrt search tree. Note that tree.connect_to_goal.item(i) == 1 iff the node is connected to the goal

  • end_pose – Desired end pose of the path

Returns:

The shortest path

Return type:

waypoints

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.generate_random_configuration(world_map: MsgWorldMap, pd: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Generates a random pose in the world.

The generated pose is generated randomly in the 2D plane with the down element (altitude) fixed. Note that the city is assumed square with world_map.city_width providing the lenght of one side of the square.

generateRandomConfiguration() routine in Algorithm 12

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • pd – The down position (i.e., altitude) to use for the search

Returns:

3x1 vector with (pn, pe) defined using a random distribution over the width

of map.

Return type:

pose

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.height_above_ground(world_map: MsgWorldMap, point: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → float¶

find the altitude of point above ground level

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • point – location in ned to calculate height

Returns:

Height at the position (A negative value implies a collision)

Return type:

h_agl

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.plan_path(start_point: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], desired_point: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], max_edge_length: float, dist: float | None = None) → tuple[ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], float]¶
Returns a point along the line formed between the two input points that is

at most the max edge length away from the starting point

planPath() routine from Algorithm 12

Parameters:

  • start_point – Starting point of the new line

  • desired_point – The point that is in the direction of the tree extension

  • max_edge_length – The maximum edge length allowed

  • dist – The distance between start and desired points. If None is passed in then the distance is calculated. Note that dist must be positive

Returns:

The along the line between start and desired points dist_to_new: The distance to the new point

Return type:

new_point

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.points_along_path(start_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], N: int) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Returns N points along path defined by the starting and ending poses

Parameters:

  • start_pose – starting point on a line

  • end_pose – ending point on a line

  • N – Number of points to return

Returns:

Points along line between start and end pose

Return type:

points

mav_sim.chap12.planner_utilities.smooth_path(waypoints: MsgWaypoints, world_map: MsgWorldMap) → MsgWaypoints¶

smooth the waypoint path - Implementation of Algorithm 13

Parameters:

  • waypoints – The path to be smoothed

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning
